Description:
Legal Director - RiyadhOn behalf of a global healthcare provider, we are seeking a Legal  Director for their Riyadh headquarters. Reporting to the GM and Global Legal teamAssist the KSA operations team with all legal matters, including leading on negotiation of supply and service contracts, corporate transactions, and data protection matters.
Manage real estate and employment law matters relating to the KSA business, with support from external counsel where required.
Manage outside counsel in their handling of any disputes and litigation.
Act as the internal Data Protection Officer for the KSA business by providing ad hoc advice and preparing and delivering internal training as required.
Act as Company Secretary for the operating KSA entities, and comply with internal corporate governance procedures and processes, and potentially serve as a member of the board of the KSA entities.
Identify and effectively manage legal risk.
Take instructions from and support the General Manager in KSA and all transactions.
Closely collaborate with internal departments in aligning operational activities with data protection legislation and KSA’s privacy and security policies.
Provide sound, commercial legal advice across all business lanes. 
Actively participate in the leadership team of the International Legal Department and contribute to the development of legal operations in KSA and globally.
Manage the legal budget and outside counsel spend.
Production of Country Risk Register and Service Reviews.
Assist with audits and execution of assurance program.
Use and keep updated internal legal IT systems, such as entity management, contract lifecycle management, and data privacy management applications.
Legal file management: including the opening, closing, archiving, and retrieval of legal files in accordance with the appropriate procedures.Skills
Skills:
Law degree from a leading university with law or legal studies as the main subject of the degree. 
You will ideally have an LLM or KSA equivalent and be registered with the local Bar Association.
You will need to have a minimum of 10+ years’ experience as a Lawyer in a reputable KSA law firm. 
Experience in providing legal assistance to lawyers in an In-house legal department.
Candidates must have excellent written and verbal communication skills (including presentations either in-person or online) in both Arabic and English. 
Candidates must have solid experience of MS PowerPoint, Word, and Excel Skills and be able to assist and/or produce PowerPoint slides for meetings under pressure and tight deadlines. 
Demonstrate excellent communication, interpersonal organizational, and presentation skills, strong research and report-generating skills.
Experience of working in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment including liaising with international colleagues to help with project management and completion.
Ability to build effective and positive client relationships quickly and fully embrace the importance of client service within the business.
